title: Inconsistent block reward in constantinople
body: Currently different BlockchainTests have different values for the block reward on the Constantinople hardfork. ` tests/ethereum-tests/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stRandom2/201503110226PYTHON_DUP6_d0g0v0.json` expects the block reward to be 3 eth, (in violation of EIP 1234 which reduces it to 2 eth). However, other tests seem to have been refilled with the new value, such as `tests/ethereum-tests/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stEIP158Specific/callToEmptyThenCallError_d0g0v0.json`, making it impossible for any single implementation to pass all of the tests.

We've also run into this issue. We've been writing tests for Constantinople in [mana](github.com/poanetwork/mana) and have found lots of tests pass if the `block_reward` and the `bomb_delay` are the ones from Byzantium, but they fail with the `block_reward` and `bomb_delay` are the ones defined in [EIP 1234](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1234.md):
